Learn how we are addressing challenges in data management, investigating current questions in the cryosphere, and developing innovative ways to add value for our data and information users.</description>    <pubDate>Fri, 17 Feb 2012 15:00:00 MST</pubDate> <!--NOTE: When updating, make sure to update the <pubDate> both in Channel, and in the new item.-->    <atom:link href="http://nsidc.org/RSS/nsidc_monthly_highlights.xml" rel="self" type="application/rss+xml" />  <item>       <title>A case of the vapors</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/january2012.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/january2012.html</guid>    <pubDate>Fri, 17 Feb 2012 15:00:00 MST</pubDate>       <description>Melting sea ice may be producing a more humid Arctic atmosphere.</description>    </item>   <item>       <title>Looking back on the International Polar Year</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/december2011.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/december2011.html</guid>    <pubDate>Wed, 18 Jan 2012 15:30:00 MST</pubDate>       <description>The 2007-2008 IPY spawned important legacies for scientific data management.</description>    </item>         <item>       <title>A Climate Data Record for sea ice</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/november2011.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/november2011.html</guid>    <pubDate>Tue, 13 Dec 2011 12:30:00 MST</pubDate>       <description>NSIDC raises sea ice data to a higher standard.</description>    </item>      <item>       <title>Greening snow and ice</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/october2011.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/october2011.html</guid>    <pubDate>Mon, 21 Nov 2011 17:15:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>NSIDC redesigns its energy-gobbling data center into an energy-sipping showcase.</description>    </item>         <item>       <title>Working the West Antarctic Ice Sheet</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/september2011.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/september2011.html</guid>    <pubDate>Mon, 17 Oct 2011 09:55:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>NSIDC hosted a three-day retreat, focused on rapid changes in the West Antarctic Ice Sheet (WAIS) and related areas of other ice caps.</description>    </item>         <item>       <title>Arctic Sea Ice News and Analysis: Near-real-time data for all</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/august2011.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/august2011.html</guid>    <pubDate>Wed, 07 Sep 2011 15:30:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>NSIDC scientist and writers share Arctic sea ice data with researchers and the general public</description>    </item>     <item>       <title>A catalog of the cryosphere</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/july2011.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/july2011.html</guid>    <pubDate>Wed, 24 Aug 2011 12:00:00 MST</pubDate>       <description>NSIDC archivists catalog the cryosphere's past.</description>    </item>     <item>       <title>Winds of change</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/june2011.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/june2011.html</guid>    <pubDate>Fri, 29 Jul 2011 17:40:00 MST</pubDate>       <description>NSIDC scientists look closely at the interplay between recent Arctic weather patterns and declining sea ice cover.</description>    </item>   <item>       <title>A new twist on climate communication</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/may2011.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/may2011.html</guid>    <pubDate>Fri, 10 Jun 2011 10:11:00 MST</pubDate>       <description>The NSIDC Icelights Web site answers questions about climate and sea ice.</description>    </item>     <item>       <title>Spanning the satellite generations</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/april2011.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/april2011.html</guid>    <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2011 17:00:00 MST</pubDate>       <description>NASA turns to individual researchers to help extend Earth's satellite record.</description>    </item>     <item>       <title>From satellites to scientists</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/march2011.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/march2011.html</guid>    <pubDate>Thu, 28 Apr 2011 10:00:00 MST</pubDate>       <description>Accessing NASA's snow and ice data at NSIDC just got a little easier.</description>    </item>     <item>       <title>Plotting the big thaw</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/february2011.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/february2011.html</guid>    <pubDate>Thu, 17 Mar 2011 12:00:00 MST</pubDate>       <description>The future of frozen ground is mushy, according to a new study by NSIDC researchers and colleagues.</description>    </item>     <item>       <title>Pressure on the Arctic</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/january2011.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/january2011.html</guid>    <pubDate>Tue, 22 Feb 2011 15:00:00 MST</pubDate>       <description>NSIDC researchers and colleagues decipher an unusual winter for Arctic sea ice.</description>    </item>     <item>       <title>Tracking a runaway glacier</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/december2010.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/december2010.html</guid>    <pubDate>Tue, 11 Jan 2011 12:00:00 MST</pubDate>       <description>Researchers use data from NASA IceBridge mission to study fast-moving glaciers in Greenland.</description>    </item>      <item>       <title>On the leading edge of sea ice</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/november2010.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/november2010.html</guid>    <pubDate>Thu, 30 Dec 2010 15:00:00 MST</pubDate>       <description>A new blend of sea ice data and observations brings the edge of the ice into sharper focus.</description>    </item>   <item>       <title>Dust on Snow Drains a Precious Resource</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/october2010.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/october2010.html</guid>    <pubDate>Tue, 9 Nov 2010 15:30:00 MST</pubDate>       <description>NSIDC researchers are exploring an unexpected risk to the Rocky Mountain snowpack and Western water supplies: a coating of desert dust.</description>    </item>   <item>       <title>Mosaic of Antarctica: Mapping a changing continent</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/september2010.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/september2010.html</guid>    <pubDate>Tue, 12 Oct 2010 10:00:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>NSIDC researchers have almost completed work on a new Mosaic of Antarctica, which will help them study changes in the Antarctic Ice Sheet.</description>    </item>  <item>       <title>Embedded Arctic researcher joins worlds of knowledge</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/august2010.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/august2010.html</guid>    <pubDate>Mon, 20 Sep 2010 12:00:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>Shari Gearheard lives year-round in Canada's far North, where she works with native Inuit to link their knowledge of the environment with climate science.</description>    </item>  <item>       <title>A Satellite Signs Off; Science Data Live On</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/july2010.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/july2010.html</guid>    <pubDate>Thu, 05 Aug 2010 17:00:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>A satellite's end is just the beginning for researchers studying changes in the cryosphere.</description>    </item>  <item>       <title>A Commons at the Poles</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/june2010.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/june2010.html</guid>    <pubDate>Wed, 14 Jul 2010 15:00:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>NSIDC helps researchers openly share their polar science data.</description>    </item>         <item>       <title>Submarine Data Emerges from the Arctic Depths</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/may2010.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/may2010.html</guid>    <pubDate>Wed, 02 Jun 2010 15:00:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>An unprecedented set of Arctic Ocean observations will soon be more accessible for ongoing research.</description>    </item>         <item>       <title>NSIDC Scientists Get a Closer Look at Accelerating Glaciers</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/apr2010.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/apr2010.html</guid>    <pubDate>Tue, 27 Apr 2010 15:00:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>NSIDC researchers travel to Antarctica to explore the causes and effects of ice shelf breakup.</description>    </item>         <item>       <title>Science and Traditional Knowledge Intersect in the Arctic</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/mar2010.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/mar2010.html</guid>    <pubDate>Tue, 06 Apr 2010 15:00:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>I believe it is time for the harpoon and the computer to work together. \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Peter Kattuk, Sanikiluaq, Nunavut</description>    </item>         <item>       <title>NASA Mission Bridges Satellite Gap; NSIDC Bridges Data Access</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/february2010.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/february2010.html</guid>    <pubDate>Tue, 09 Mar 2010 15:00:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>NSIDC supports NASA in its quest to ensure continuous study of ice in Earth's polar regions.</description>    </item>     <item>       <title>Techno-Archaeology Rescues Climate Data from Early Satellites</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/january2010.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/january2010.html</guid>    <pubDate>Fri, 5 Feb 2010 15:00:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>NSIDC and NASA data scientists proved the use of 21st-century techniques to revive data from 1960s satellites.</description>    </item>      <item>       <title>Searchlight Puts Data in a Whole New Light</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/december2009.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/december2009.html</guid>    <pubDate>Wed, 13 Jan 2010 08:00:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>NSIDC is reducing the distance between our users and our cryospheric data holdings, thanks to an evolution in NSIDC data architecture called Searchlight.</description>    </item>         <item>       <title>NSIDC DAAC Data Pick Up Speed</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/november2009.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/november2009.html</guid>    <pubDate>Mon, 7 Dec 2009 12:00:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>This year, access to data at NSIDC improved significantly, as a result of a substantial archive-technology shift and data migration by the NSIDC Distributed Active Archive Center (DAAC).</description>    </item>         <item>       <title>Glacier Photographs at NSIDC</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/october2009.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/october2009.html</guid>    <pubDate>Thu, 29 Oct 2009 15:00:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>The National Snow and Ice Data Center houses an extensive collection of glacier photographs that constitute an important historical record, providing visual evidence of how glaciers have changed over time.</description>    </item>       <item>       <title>Introducing ROCS</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/september2009.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/september2009.html</guid>    <pubDate>Mon, 14 Sep 2009 08:49:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>The National Snow and Ice Data Center's Library and Analog Archives have a new name and a new presence. Please meet the new Roger G. Barry Resource Office for Cryospheric Studies (ROCS) at NSIDC. With the new name comes a new effort to make these collections visible and accessible to external audiences.</description>    </item>         <item>       <title>Arctic Amplification</title>       <link>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/august2009.html</link>    <guid>http://nsidc.org/monthlyhighlights/august2009.html</guid>    <pubDate>Mon, 17 Aug 2009 15:30:00 MDT</pubDate>       <description>Recent Septembers have seen the extent of Arctic sea ice cover fall to about 60% of levels in the early 1970s. The past two years, 2007 and 2008, saw the lowest and second-lowest ice extent ever recorded.</description>    </item>           </channel> </rss>
